reference.title: Shared Server Information object
reference.shortdesc: The Shared Server Information object provides information about the configuration of an Atom’s shared web server.

section.title: Structure
section.codeblock: <SharedServerInformation sslCertificateId="" atomId="" checkForwardedHeaders="" maxThreads="" externalHttpsPort="" externalHttpPort="" externalHost="" internalHost="" minAuth="" auth="" httpsPort="" httpPort="" authToken="" overrideUrl="" url="" apiType=""/>

row.entry: The component ID for the SSL certificate used by the server, if applicable.
The ID of the Atom that is hosting the shared web server.

Information regarding the external host, etc. might be forwarded in headers. The embedded Java technology is capable of examining these headers and extracting external host information for response/callback purposes. Set this to true to enable the server to check for this information. The default is false.
The maximum number of handler threads that the listen process spawn. Other requests are queued.
The external HTTPS port routes to the shared web server listener.
The external HTTP port routes to the shared web server listener.
The external host name or IP for the listener.
For multi-homed boxes, an IP address to be used for binding to a specific interface.

The minimum authentication required by the web server.
Options are none and basic. The Atom Clouds are multi-tenant, so by default they are set to basic. Local Atoms and Molecules by default are set to none.

The authentication required by the web server.
Options are none and basic. If minAuth is set to basic, auth must also be set to basic.
The SSL (HTTPS) port on which the web server listens, if applicable. The default is 9093.
The HTTP port on which the web server listens. The default is 9090.
An authentication token for connecting to the shared web server, if it is configured for BASIC authentication. This cannot be updated by the UPDATE operation.

Allows manual overriding of the exposed URL used to connect to the shared web server.
This value is for informational purposes for any tenant. By default, this is false meaning the URL is constructed based on the host name or external host name and port/SSL port settings. Set this to true to specify a custom URL attribute value.
The URL for connecting to the shared web server.

The level of user management and API management functionality that is applicable to the shared web server.
Options are basic, intermediate, and advanced. The default is intermediate.

li.p: Shared Server Information records are only retrievable by an ordinary GET operation specifying a single Atom ID or a bulk GET operation specifying a maximum of 100 Atom IDs. The Shared Server Information object ID is not available currently (except by requesting the information from services). The Shared Server Information object auth field is not returned by this operation.
The UPDATE operation updates a Shared Server Information object based on the supplied Atom ID. To clear a field, set the attribute corresponding to that field to an empty string.
You must have the Atom Management privilege to perform the UPDATE operation. If you have the Atom Management Read Access privilege, you cannot update shared server information.

It is not possible to set authToken through this operation. If authentication is required but a token does not currently exist, this operation generates a token. The new authToken appears in the response.
If sslCertificateId is specified, the certificate must be accessible by the account making the request.

If the Authentication Type and Ports are not already configured, using the Shared Server Information object to update only the API Type of an Atom fails. If you are the Atom, Molecule, or Atom Cloud owner, you must update the API Type, Authentication Type, and either HTTP Port or HTTPS Port through the Shared Server Information object through the Shared Server Information object for the API to succeed. Atom Cloud attachments can not update the HTTP Port or HTTPS Port.
If the Authentication Type and Ports are already configured, the Shared Server Information object can be used to update only the API Type of an Atom.
The configuration of multiple authentication types on an Atom is not supported in this API.
Send an HTTP GET to:
where accountId is the authenticating account for the request and id is the Atom ID.
XML response:
li.codeblock: <bns:SharedServerInformation sslCertificateId="6789abcd-ef01-2345-6789-abcdef012345" atomId="3456789a-bcde-f012-3456-789abcdef012" checkForwardedHeaders="false" maxThreads="250" externalHttpsPort="0" externalHttpPort="0" externalHost="" internalHost="127.0.0.1" minAuth="basic" httpsPort="9093" httpPort="9090" authToken="bcdef012-3456-789a-bcde-f0123456789a" overrideUrl="false" url="http://system.sub.domain.tld:9090" apiType="basic" xmlns:bns="http://api.platform.boomi.com/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"/>
li.p: For a JSON response, send the request with the following HTTP header:
JSON response:
Send an HTTP POST to:
where accountId is the authenticating account for the request and id is the Atom ID.
li.note:
If the Authentication Type and Ports are not already configured, using the Shared Server Information object to update only the API Type of an Atom fails. If you are the Atom, Molecule, or Atom Cloud owner, you must update the API Type, Authentication Type, and either HTTP Port or HTTPS Port through the Shared Server Information object through the Shared Server Information object for the API to succeed. Atom Cloud attachments can not update the HTTP Port or HTTPS Port.
If the Authentication Type and Ports are already configured, the Shared Server Information object can be used to update only the API Type of an Atom.
li.p: This example updates maxThreads, the maximum number of handler threads that the listen process spawns, to 100.

XML response:

JSON request:

JSON response:
Request:
Response:
li.codeblock: <S:Envelope xmlns:S="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> <S:Body> <bns:getResponse xmlns:bns="http://api.platform.boomi.com/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <bns:result xsi:type="bns:SharedServerInformation" sslCertificateId="6789abcd-ef01-2345-6789-abcdef012345" atomId="3456789a-bcde-f012-3456-789abcdef012" checkForwardedHeaders="false" maxThreads="250" externalHttpsPort="0" externalHttpPort="0" externalHost="" internalHost="127.0.0.1" minAuth="basic" httpsPort="9093" httpPort="9090" authToken="bcdef012-3456-789a-bcde-f0123456789a" overrideUrl="false" url="http://system.sub.domain.tld:9090" apiType="basic"/> </bns:getResponse> </S:Body> </S:Envelope>

li.note:
If the Authentication Type and Ports are not already configured, using the Shared Server Information object to update only the API Type of an Atom fails. If you are the Atom, Molecule, or Atom Cloud owner, you must update the API Type, Authentication Type, and either HTTP Port or HTTPS Port through the Shared Server Information object through the Shared Server Information object for the API to succeed. Atom Cloud attachments can not update the HTTP Port or HTTPS Port.
If the Authentication Type and Ports are already configured, the Shared Server Information object can be used to update only the API Type of an Atom.
li.p: This example updates maxThreads, the maximum number of handler threads that the listen process spawns, to 100.
Request:
Response:
li.codeblock: <S:Envelope xmlns:S="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/"> <S:Body> <bns:updateResponse xmlns:bns="http://api.platform.boomi.com/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"> <result xsi:type="bns:SharedServerInformation" sslCertificateId="6789abcd-ef01-2345-6789-abcdef012345" atomId="f453d1ed-fd7e-4a61-8edf-d61f73a01adb" checkForwardedHeaders="false" maxThreads="100" externalHttpsPort="0" externalHttpPort="0" externalHost="" internalHost="127.0.0.1" minAuth="basic" auth="basic" httpsPort="9093" httpPort="9090" authToken="bcdef012-3456-789a-bcde-f0123456789a" overrideUrl="false" url="http://system.sub.domain.tld:9090" apiType="basic"/> </bns:updateResponse> </S:Body> </S:Envelope>
